intro: Cumetea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cumetea, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. Due to habitat loss, Cumetea angustifolia is considered endangered and is of particular interest in botanical conservation efforts.
